title: GZIP Compression not working in servlet application
body:
### Describe the bug

I am working on the JSF/Faces extensions for Quarkus for OmniFaces and PrimeFaces.

Using `quarkus.http.enable-compression=true` is not compressing any of my JS or CSS files as expected based on Mime Type.


### Expected behavior

GZIP compression should occur

### Actual behavior

No Gzip compression is happening with `quarkus.http.enable-compression=true`

### How to Reproduce?

Reproducer: [quarkus-compression.zip](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/10831165/quarkus-compression.zip)

1. Unzip the reproducer
2. Run `mvn quarkus:dev`
3. Open browser to http://localhost:8080/ 
4. Open F12 and inspect the traffic GZIP compression is not taking place even though the `Content-Type: application/javascript` is correct.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4399574/221357554-8219f1a7-19f5-4fb5-bf63-5c354180c098.png)


### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.22621.1265]

### Output of `java -version`

OpenJDK Runtime Environment Temurin-17.0.5+8 (build 17.0.5+8)

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.16.3

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.8.6 (84538c9988a25aec085021c365c560670ad80f63)

### Additional information

I have also tested trying to custom set mime-types and it has no effect using `quarkus.http.compress-media-types=` but it also has no effect.  But the defaults of ` text/html, text/plain, text/xml, text/css, text/javascript and application/javascript.` are all I need anyway.
